input_text:
Job Title: Enterprise Application Engineer

Location: Hackensack, NJ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Job Summary

Are you ready to elevate your career in Enterprise Apllication? Take charge of administering, developing, and supporting cutting-edge platforms like Elite 3E. From coordinating system upgrades to optimizing performance and exploring innovative technologies, you'll play a pivotal role in shaping the firm's technological landscape. If you're driven by challenge and innovation, this is the opportunity you've been waiting for. Apply now and let's embark on this exciting journey together!

location: Hackensack, New Jersey

job type: Permanent

salary: $135,000 - 140,000 per year

work hours: 8am to 5pm

education: Bachelors

Responsibilities

Administer, develop, and support the Firm's Elite 3E platform, encompassing Thompson Reuters Elite 3E, Paperless Performa, Design Gallery ("DG"), Workspace, and Iridium. Responsibilities within the firm's financial/marketing application stack include:

 Scheduling month-end maintenance activities like Windows updates, SQL maintenance, query optimization, and security patching. Coordinating inter-departmentally during system upgrades, assessing and communicating risk factors of upcoming upgrades, especially when integrated systems lead to a "trickle-down" effect. Collaborating with application stakeholders and the IT team to prioritize and address issues and future objectives for financial systems. Conducting testing of financial system applications during system changes, enhancements, upgrades, and monthly system maintenance. Documenting system setup, integrations, backup, and disaster recovery processes. Communicating project statuses, issues, and proposed resolutions to the department and management. Managing vendor support tickets. Monitoring and optimizing system performance and storage utilization, planning for necessary hardware or software upgrades to support system growth. Researching and evaluating new tools/technologies to enhance the current application stack. Utilizing tools to safeguard application source code and maintain versioning. Fulfilling any additional responsibilities as required by management.

Other Responsibilities Include

 Administering, maintaining, and integrating Compulaw. Performing basic 'end user' application troubleshooting and maintenance for tools such as FasTax, B&A Forms, Allstate legal forms, LexisNexis, etc. Handling support requests/tickets escalated from the helpdesk team. Documenting processes/procedures, creating 'how-to' guides, and resolving frequently asked questions.

Qualifications

Experience level: ExperiencedMinimum 5 years of experienceEducation: Bachelors

Skills

Elite 3E Platform (4 years of experience is required)SQL (5 years of experience is required)Windows (5 years of experience is required)C# (1 year of experience is preferred)Active Directory (5 years of experience is required)Thomson Reuters 3E (4 years of experience is preferred)

Equal Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.

At Randstad Digital, we welcome people of all abilities and want to ensure that our hiring and interview process meets the needs of all applicants. If you require a reasonable accommodation to make your application or interview experience a great one, please contact HRsupport@randstadusa.com.

Pay offered to a successful candidate will be based on several factors including the candidate's education, work experience, work location, specific job duties, certifications, etc. In addition, Randstad Digital offers a comprehensive benefits package, including health, an incentive and recognition program, and 401K contribution (all benefits are based on eligibility).

Applications accepted on ongoing basis until filled.

Experience Level (if available): None
